benchmark_details.name: UAV-Need-Help
benchmark_details.overview: UAV-Need-Help is an assistant-guided UAV object search benchmark that helps UAVs navigate to target objects using descriptions and guidance. It provides varying levels of assistance to improve performance in realistic VLN tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To promote research and development in UAV vision-language navigation tasks through realistic trajectories and assistant-guided object searches.

data.source: Constructed using the OpenUAV platform with real flight simulation data and human control.
data.annotation: Human annotators conducted a continuous flight on the OpenUA V platform, generating descriptions using GPT-4 and reviewing for quality.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on UAV's success in navigating to target objects as per provided instructions in various scenarios.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better navigation performance and efficiency in reaching target locations.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against Random, Fixed Action, and CMA models with results indicating significant improvements over baselines.
methodology.validation: Validated through closed-loop evaluations and comparisons across metrics in seen and unseen environments.
